body:
registerd and activated a fresh phonenumber by requestCode and registerCode and got an OK status.

i run checkCredentials and get an error, i var_dumped the response and see:

```object(stdClass)#5 (4) {
  ["status"]=>
  string(7) "created"
  ["id"]=>
  string(28) "uZOYuisx4L6dVYkFWQRP1SKANF8="
  ["sms_length"]=>
  int(6)
  ["voice_length"]=>
  int(6)
}```

status is created? 
But class is looking for  ```if ($response->status != 'ok')``` 

When i change it to $response->status != 'created'
i still can't send messages: see below

```
tx  </stream:features>

tx  <auth xmlns="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:xmpp-sasl" mechanism="WAUTH-1" user="316xxxxxxxx"></auth>

rx  <start from="s.whatsapp.net"></start>

rx  <stream:features>
rx    <receipt_acks></receipt_acks>
rx  </stream:features>

rx  <challenge xmlns="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:xmpp-sasl">„«'Þï{¼E¿×ÜUÐéKw</challenge>

tx  <response xmlns="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:xmpp-sasl">©ÅŠÌ.)·5Î~^
)ÝEÉT­DôzäZ€j½ìŒÕ!Ä6–)qw=¥ 8</response>

rx  <failure xmlns="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:xmpp-sasl">
rx    <not-authorized></not-authorized>
rx  </failure>

tx  <presence type="available" name="testfromme"></presence>
NULL

tx  <message to="316xxxxxxxx@s.whatsapp.net" type="chat" id="1367085119-1" t="1367085119">
tx    <x xmlns="jabber:x:event">
tx      <server></server>
tx    </x>
tx    <notify xmlns="urn:xmpp:whatsapp" name="testfromme"></notify>
tx    <request xmlns="urn:xmpp:receipts"></request>
tx    <body>Hey hello!</body>
tx  </message>
```

So i guess i have to wait for status=ok? 
Or did whatsapp changed things?
Any thougths?

comment_data.body:
Just use your damn password instead

    $wa->LoginWithPassword($password);
can you do a var_dump of $b ?

the thing is.. the password is changing everytime, so when i first get $b->pw and hardcode it in my code, like 
$wa->LoginWithPassword('DptDFhoXBP5pYZRL2dnTFZddU9M=');

i get (when sending message):
```
rx  <failure xmlns="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:xmpp-sasl">
rx    <not-authorized></not-authorized>
rx  </failure>
```
So how do i get the pw (besides activating it everytime with registerCode)?

ah now i see, i was still calling registerCode all the time... :) ( so the pw kept changing)
Any thoughts how long this pw will survive? (cause in the source i read ' WhatsApp now changes your password everytime you use this' )

and this is a dedicated number and simcard, in a very old nokia c1 just to receive the activation sms.

The password will survive as long as you don't call any of the three methods I mentioned

There is one exception though: https://github.com/tgalal/yowsup/issues/117#issuecomment-16712490
Apparently WhatsApp randomly changes your password after some time, this is not implemented yet.
I'll look into this when I get to it, best way to go would be to add a "onPasswordChanged" event and let the surrounding application update the password in its own storage.

The keyword he used is "like" ;) I'll have to encounter one of these nodes in real life before I can actually identify them and add it to processInboudData()

And yes, if you use your number on your phone client you're gonna have a bad time :')


Mmm guess it's time for a little investment, getting a €10 prepaid SIM card for testing tomorrow :/

In the meantime I'll show WhatsApiNet some love, apparently someone forked that repository yay!

We are planning to use your php in production (sending customers their orderconfirmation.. maybe with an image attached.. still trying to debug that, but somehow my test recipient numbers do not receive anymore messages today, lets find out tomorrow).

So we'll be logging a lot of messages, so lets see if we find something 'like' pwreset.. ;)

yep. after about 400 numbers:

{ ["status"]=> string(4) "fail" ["reason"]=> string(7) "blocked" }
Sucks. Did you sync all 400 in a single request or did you use batches of e.g. 50 numbers each?

We used a blank number / whatsapp account. And tested with clients ordering at our website. We've sent each client 1 plain message and 1 image , after 12 hours we noticed the block.
Time between the requests vary from 1-5 seconds to a few hours. (we've sent the messages realtime when payment was processed)

Just to keep it clear, we're not sending spam, but are trying to find different ways of reaching our clients.

Nice one ☺

I need to get a new test number and let you know.
We also try to see what happens with the block on our current number in a few days. Maybe they’ll release the block…

You could try making the communication two-way like I mentioned above e.g. requiring your customers to reply to your message using the confirmation code you've just sent them.

e.g.
- you: Hello user xxxxxx please confirm your registration by replying '543456'
- user: 543456
- you (optional): Thank you for completing the registration!

I can also imagine that this will generate a lot of traffic on a single phonenumber, so maybe you could use multiple numbers and cycle through them for each user e.g.

user1 -> phone 1 (assign phone to user so they won't receive messages from different numbers)
user2 -> phone 2
user3 -> phone 3
user4 -> phone 1
user5 -> phone 2
etc.

Their EULA states that you're not allowed to generate more traffic than a normal human user would, so you could circumvent this by distributing the load over multiple numbers.
.gitignore

WhatsApp is a f**k.... It blocked my number while I was sending same messages to my whatsapp contacts from my phone.. I sent max 23 times nd got blocked..
using my phone..
What was the delay between them?

I was sending message from my phone using official whatsapp client.. but i got blocked.. I was sending message regularly max 4-5 sec interval..
just using forwarding functionality in whatsapp client..
Official client got banned? That's new for me...

title: checkCredentials returns status=created?
